rComments: Alright. Brett is a cool guy, unfortunately that's not what I look for in a professor whose class I'm paying for. You'll learn a lot about how he views the world, and you'll learn some words that may or may not exist. I didn't learn much, but I got to experience a super eccentric prof who is VERY passionate about what his work.

Brett is really into his spirituality and you're going to hear about that more than anything. He really likes to hear himself talk and he isn't really clear what he wants in a paper. Regardless of the effort you put into your papers, be prepared for your grades to be a surprised based on how he feels about what you write.

Brett is an amazing person and mentor. As a writer himself, he may be seen as a space cadet who's actively engaged in his own stories and fantasy, but when you do care about writing and improving, he would be there for you. He even bought me a cup of coffee at Verve. He's a true friend and mentor.

The trick to doing well in Brett's class is to go with it. He isn't always clear in his instructions because he wants you have creative freedom. All in all he is a good instructor. He is very happy to help students on their current essay and provide good feedback. If you need structured assignments, you might want to consider a different instructor

Brett is very interested in hearing himself talk and glorifying himself. Most of his class time, in fact, is spent talking about his opinions and how he feels, and if he ever gives a student a chance to talk, he usually interrupts them. Grading is ok if you show him you've "made progress" i.e. point out what HE thinks you needed to change.
TERRIBLE TERRIBLE TERRIBLE!!! I don't even know what this guy is talking about most of the time. He does not help and does not teach.

This teacher is awful when it comes to academics but a genuine person when it comes to being his friend. Nevertheless, avoid this class at all costs if you want to learn anything or be challenged at all. He does not return papers until the end of the semester and he rants about things that don't matter and don't make sense rather than teaching.
Brett is a very inspirational professor who does go off on tangents, but are still relevant to the material. I highly recommend his classes, very interesting.

His "lectures" are nothing more than nonsensical rants that don't relate to what we're learning. He has trouble focusing what he's saying into a coherent statement and he doesn't answer questions directly. He doesn't return work in a timely manner and doesn't "believe in grades". If you hope to improve your writing, DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS.
Brett is a really nice guy and has interesting stories but his teaching style is a little confusing at times.

Brett is more concerned with his own personal spirituality, than the actual context of the course. He goes off on irrelevant tangents, and has an inability to answer a question. Seems like a nice guy, but has creepy vibes. Doesn't hand back work, and it is hard to be engaged dueT to the fact that he talks too much about nothing.
Took his class at CSUMB. Talked a ton, but just chill out and listen to his awesome stories. And if not then don't show up and still get an A.

Brett wants to empower and motivate students. He is an inspiring person, doesn't give a typical lecture. Very "Santa Cruz" kind of guy. Lecture is quite dull, but his assignments are fun and let you go beyond what you would normally do. For example, many of my essays included illustrations.

Brett has a beautiful soul and  much to share if you have the patients to try and understand where he is coming from. People seem to have problems with him but I think that its more about motivational issues than communication issues. He's far out and it can be hard to relate with him, but if you can, his class will be a groovy experience.

Brett is a really nice/sweet guy and will give you extensions if you need them, but everything that people already said is very true. He talks a LOT. He also explains a lot of information that he believes is relevant, when in fact it isn't. Just a pretty abstract person in general.

This guy really does jus ttalk and talk is get to be way too much. He might know a lot but now we do to about his own life, i wish we had our final on his life i would get an even easier A, but he is a smart guy just needs to stop getting off track and stop talking about himself.

Brett just loves to hear himself talk.  He teaches you absolutely nothing.  Throughout the course he repeats the same lecture, attempting to inspire you to achieve your potential or something.  The first day I had to work really hard to keep from laughing, and by the end I just loathed the class.

At least I had a great IA, otherwise this class would have been a complete waste of my time. I'm sure Brett is brilliant, but he has trouble communicating clearly, throwing us all off. IA meetings consisted of our IA translating what Brett had said in the lecture for us.

He is a nice guy but I didn't learn one thing from him. My writing hasn't gotten any better and class is a complete waste of time. I don't really find his stories to be engaging becasue they are so irrelivant to the topic. He just can't stay focused, I wouldn't reccomend him as a teacher.

This class was the worst class of my fall quarter.  Brett has a difficult time staying on topic.  His lectures are chalk full of unnessicary discriptors and tangents that melt the object of the class beyond recognition.  Personal stories are frequent and rarely related back to the subject material.  A poor introduction to college writing.

Brett was an interesting guy with a lot to say about his life. We pretty much got nothing done in this class and my I.A. was terrible. She didn't know what to do in section so she made up random lesson plans and excercises which had no educational value. 2 five page essays and a few two page ones. Pretty easy.

Greider's class was my favorite class Fall quarter. He would always tell us some story about surfing with seals and hitchhiking and relate them to class, life, globalization, etc. He has lead such an interesting life and is able to relate with the course material because of it. He cares a lot about his teaching and his students.
lots on interesting stories, not much else

This guy is so interesting and fun to hear talk, he has engaging stories about his own life but he tries to connect them to real life. He makes the greatest analogies, really livened up the class. He's also just a nice person who is extremely helpful and happy to be teaching.

he teaches for college 9, actually. he's really cultured and smart, but this guy can talk for HOURS about himself. if i were taking "Brett's life 101" i could ace it. jesus. but yeah, very...philosophical. think eistein, indiana jones and the apostles rolled into one. whatever the hell that means.
